document_name: Organic Law of Regional Governments, Law No. 27867
document_url: https://cdn.climatepolicyradar.org/PER/2002/PER-2002-11-18-Organic Law of Regional Governments, Law No. 27867_14c40adeea727add3e42438b8c459e81.pdf
document_description: This broad legislation is meant to decentralise governance in the country and is a pillar of the juridical-legal framework of contemporary Peru. As such, most of the legislation is unrelated to climate change or the natural environment. However, it states explicitly that regional governments must formulate, co-ordinate, manage and supervise regional strategies to address climate change within the national framework (the National Strategy on Climate Change and additional legislation, executive decrees and ministerial resolutions).
